intro: Convolvulus waitaha, commonly known as Waitaha bindweed, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest floors and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important part of New Zealand's native flora.
